question: Which of the following is the period of the "Cycladic culture"?
explanation: Cycladic culture (also known as Cycladic civilisation or, Cycladic chronology) was a Bronze Age culture (c. 3200â€“c. 1050 BC) found throughout the islands of the Cyclades in the Aegean Sea. In chronological terms, it is a relative dating system for artefacts which broadly complements Helladic chronology (mainland Greece) and Minoan chronology (Crete) during the same period of time.
